job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Data Engineer who loves dealing with large quantities of text and audio data. The successful candidate will be proficient in using machine learning techniques to build data processing pipelines, preparing ready-to-train datasets for large models.

   If you are excited about the intersection of AI, Machine Learning, and Large Data, this role provides a unique opportunity to make a high-impact contribution.   

   Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!

        You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems. You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will have experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release.

       You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, our R&D research is guided by our co-founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.

   If you know and love Voicebox, Whisper, VALL-E, SPEAR-TTS and more - and you love machine learning and large data, then we would love to talk to you. We will also want to talk to you - if that's what you dream of doing.  

What will you be doing?

     In this position, you'll join the team to help develop our LLM-based TTS system that will provide our customers with voice clones that are indistinguishable from real voices. You will also help us create high quality, production ready code and take ownership of production pipelines. This would include:
     * Designing, developing, and maintaining data processing pipelines, utilising machine learning techniques to handle vast amounts of text and audio data, while ensuring data quality and accessibility.
     * Leveraging your understanding of machine learning algorithms and workflows to prepare data most effectively for usage in large scale models.
     * Use Big Data tools and frameworks to process, analyse, and derive insights from structured and unstructured data.
     * Collaborating with other ML Engineers and Researchers to understand their data requirements and provide them with ready-to-train datasets.
     * Monitoring the performance of data pipeline and machine learning models, troubleshoot data-related issues, and perform root cause analysis to implement strategic solutions.
     * Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and tools in machine learning and data engineering to continually improve our data infrastructure.
     * Document data pipeline architecture and workflow, present findings to relevant stakeholders, and provide training as needed., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in Amsterdam
job_details.full_text:
Machine Learning Data Engineer

We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Data Engineer who loves dealing with large quantities of text and audio data. The successful candidate will be proficient in using machine learning techniques to build data processing pipelines, preparing ready-to-train datasets for large models.

   If you are excited about the intersection of AI, Machine Learning, and Large Data, this role provides a unique opportunity to make a high-impact contribution.   

   Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!

        You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems. You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will have experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release.

       You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, our R&D research is guided by our co-founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.

   If you know and love Voicebox, Whisper, VALL-E, SPEAR-TTS and more - and you love machine learning and large data, then we would love to talk to you. We will also want to talk to you - if that's what you dream of doing.  

What will you be doing?

     In this position, you'll join the team to help develop our LLM-based TTS system that will provide our customers with voice clones that are indistinguishable from real voices. You will also help us create high quality, production ready code and take ownership of production pipelines. This would include:
     * Designing, developing, and maintaining data processing pipelines, utilising machine learning techniques to handle vast amounts of text and audio data, while ensuring data quality and accessibility.
     * Leveraging your understanding of machine learning algorithms and workflows to prepare data most effectively for usage in large scale models.
     * Use Big Data tools and frameworks to process, analyse, and derive insights from structured and unstructured data.
     * Collaborating with other ML Engineers and Researchers to understand their data requirements and provide them with ready-to-train datasets.
     * Monitoring the performance of data pipeline and machine learning models, troubleshoot data-related issues, and perform root cause analysis to implement strategic solutions.
     * Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and tools in machine learning and data engineering to continually improve our data infrastructure.
     * Document data pipeline architecture and workflow, present findings to relevant stakeholders, and provide training as needed., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in Amsterdam

profile_classification.rationale: The role heavily emphasizes building data processing pipelines for large models, preparing datasets, and leveraging machine learning algorithms for data preparation. While generative models are mentioned, the core focus is on the data engineering and ML modeling aspects rather than building user-facing GenAI applications.

phrases.phrase: dealing with large quantities of text and audio data
phrases.justification: This phrase directly relates to handling and processing large volumes of raw data, a core aspect of data engineering.

phrases.phrase: build data processing pipelines
phrases.justification: This is a fundamental responsibility within data engineering, involving the creation and maintenance of systems to move and transform data.

phrases.phrase: preparing ready-to-train datasets for large models
phrases.justification: This involves cleaning, transforming, and structuring data specifically for machine learning model consumption, a key data engineering task.

phrases.phrase: Designing, developing, and maintaining data processing pipelines, utilising machine learning techniques to handle vast amounts of text and audio data, while ensuring data quality and accessibility.
phrases.justification: This bullet point explicitly describes the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines, including data handling and quality assurance, which are central to data engineering.

phrases.phrase: Use Big Data tools and frameworks to process, analyse, and derive insights from structured and unstructured data.
phrases.justification: This task involves working with large datasets and specialized tools for processing and analysis, a common responsibility in data engineering.

phrases.phrase: Monitoring the performance of data pipeline and machine learning models, troubleshoot data-related issues, and perform root cause analysis to implement strategic solutions.
phrases.justification: Monitoring and troubleshooting data pipelines is a crucial part of maintaining data infrastructure, falling under data engineering responsibilities.

phrases.phrase: Document data pipeline architecture and workflow
phrases.justification: Documentation of data infrastructure is an essential part of data engineering to ensure maintainability and understanding.

phrases.phrase: using machine learning techniques to build data processing pipelines
phrases.justification: While the primary focus is on pipelines, the mention of 'machine learning techniques' suggests their application in the data processing itself, which can involve modeling aspects.

phrases.phrase: preparing data most effectively for usage in large scale models
phrases.justification: This implies understanding how models consume data and tailoring the preparation process accordingly, which requires knowledge of modeling principles.

phrases.phrase: Leveraging your understanding of machine learning algorithms and workflows
phrases.justification: Directly refers to the application and understanding of ML algorithms, a core component of the modeling task.

phrases.phrase: help develop our LLM-based TTS system
phrases.justification: This indicates involvement in the development of a system that uses LLMs, which falls under the modeling category, specifically generative modeling.

phrases.phrase: voice clones that are indistinguishable from real voices
phrases.justification: This describes the output and goal of a generative modeling task (Text-to-Speech), implying work on or with such models.

phrases.phrase: loves to code and build working systems
phrases.justification: General statement indicating a preference for hands-on coding and system building, which is part of software development.

phrases.phrase: experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release.
phrases.justification: Explicitly mentions the software development lifecycle, a key aspect of software engineering.

phrases.phrase: build working systems
phrases.justification: Indicates the creation of functional software, a core software development activity.

phrases.phrase: create high quality, production ready code
phrases.justification: Focuses on the quality and readiness of code for production, a standard software development practice.

phrases.phrase: take ownership of production pipelines
phrases.justification: While pipelines can be data engineering, 'ownership' and 'production ready' lean towards software development practices for operational systems.

phrases.phrase: take ownership of production pipelines
phrases.justification: Owning production pipelines implies responsibility for their deployment, monitoring, and maintenance, which aligns with MLOps.

phrases.phrase: Monitoring the performance of data pipeline and machine learning models
phrases.justification: Monitoring is a key MLOps activity, ensuring models and pipelines function correctly in production.

phrases.phrase: troubleshoot data-related issues
phrases.justification: Troubleshooting production systems, including data pipelines and models, is an MLOps responsibility.

phrases.phrase: implement strategic solutions
phrases.justification: Implementing solutions to production issues often involves operational adjustments and improvements, part of MLOps.

phrases.phrase: Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and tools in machine learning and data engineering to continually improve our data infrastructure.
phrases.justification: Continuous improvement of infrastructure and staying updated with tools is a common MLOps practice.

phrases.phrase: Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!
phrases.justification: This describes the overarching business goal and vision of the company, providing context for the technical work.

phrases.phrase: help develop our LLM-based TTS system that will provide our customers with voice clones that are indistinguishable from real voices.
phrases.justification: This connects the technical development to a customer-facing product and business objective (providing voice clones).

phrases.phrase: collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas
phrases.justification: Implies working with various stakeholders and understanding different research needs, which requires business context.

phrases.phrase: Collaborating with other ML Engineers and Researchers to understand their data requirements
phrases.justification: Understanding the needs of other teams and researchers is a form of business understanding within the R&D context.

phrases.phrase: present findings to relevant stakeholders
phrases.justification: Presenting technical work to stakeholders requires translating technical details into business-relevant information.

instances: Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and tools in machine learning and data engineering to continually improve our data infrastructure.
loves to code and build working systems
Collaborating with other ML Engineers and Researchers to understand their data requirements and provide them with ready-to-train datasets.
perform root cause analysis to implement strategic solutions.
